page.title: 13 PITCOMBE CHURCH NR.BRUTON
page.content: People have worshipped God on the site of Pitcombe Church for 800 years. All that remains of the earliest church is the Norman font.The tower of the church is 15th century,with three bells from Pre-Reformation days.The rest of the church was restored in 1858,not in normal Victorian style,but in a genuine attempt to repeat the original medieval appearance of the church. Nowadays,this beautiful church is tucked away down leafy lanes,but once it lay on an old road linking several hamlets as the focal point. Pitcombe Church is dedicated to St. Leonard,a hermit of the 6th century,a very popular religious figure in the Middle Ages.His feast-day is 6th November.Pitcombe is a perfect rural church,in a perfect rural setting.
